intro: Microstemon velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf microstemon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. Microstemon velutina is often found in riparian zones and is adapted to periodic flooding.
